class Cheap
  attr_reader :result
  attr_reader :m
  attr_reader :n
  attr_reader :a
  attr_reader :b

  def initialize
    @result = 0
  end

  def calculate(n, m, a, b)
    m_ratio = b / m
    if m_ratio >= a 
      @result = n * a
    else
      if m >= n
          @result = [a * n, b].min
      else
        q = n / m
        r = (n - (m * q))
        @result = [(q * b) + r * a, (q * b) + r * b].min
      end
    end
    return @result
  end
end

def fact(x)
  fact = 1
  x.times do |el|
    fact *= (el + 1)
    #fact %= (10**9 + 7)
  end
  fact
end


def fact_mod(x)
  fact = 1
  x.times do |el|
    fact *= (el + 1)
    fact %= (10**9 + 7)
  end
  fact
end

def fc(n, k)
  fact(n)/(fact(n - k)) # % (10**9 + 7)
end

def process(arr)
	res = 0

		tmp = arr.pop
		arr_tmp = []
		arr_tmp.push(tmp)
		i = arr.length-1
		while i >= 0
			arr_tmp.push(arr[i])
			u = 0
			r = 0
			d = 0
			l = 0
			arr_tmp.each{ |e|
				if e == 'U'; u += 1;break; end
				if e == 'R'; r += 1;break; end
				if e == 'D'; d += 1;break; end
				if e == 'L'; l += 1;break; end
			}
			res += 1 if u == d && r == l
			i -= 1
		end
	end
	puts res
	
end

  case l

  end
end

#!/usr/bin/ruby

def countOnes(array,n)

	count_1 = 0

	for i in (0..n-1)
		if array[i] == 1 then
			count_1 += 1
		end
	end

	for i in (0..n-1)
		array[i] = (array[i] == 1) ? -1 : 1
	end

	max_ending_here, max_overall = 0 , 0

	for i in (0..n-1)
		max_ending_here += array[i]

		if max_ending_here < 0 then
			max_ending_here = 0
		end

		if max_ending_here > max_overall
			max_overall = max_ending_here
		end
	end

	return max_overall + count_1
end

    if idx == n

	ret = $mem[idx][bool]
	if ret != -100000
		return ret

	if bool == 1

	else
		ret = [dp(idx+1,0,n) , dp(idx+1,1,n)+$number[idx]].max
	end
	
	$mem[idx][bool] = ret
	return ret
end

def solution(arr)
  if arr.size == 1
    return 1 if arr[0] == 0
    return 0 if arr[0] == 1
  end

  initial_value = arr.reduce(:+)
  return initial_value - 1 if initial_value == arr.size

  acumulator = initial_value
  max_value = 0

  for i in 0...arr.size do
    acumulator = [initial_value, acumulator + (arr[i] == 1 ? -1 : 1)].max
    max_value = [max_value, acumulator].max
  end
  max_value
end

def flip_sum(t,i,e)
    t[i..e] = t[i..e].map { |v|  v = 1 - v }
    return t.inject(0){|sum,x| sum + x}
end


def get_result(b, e, dpa)
    best = dpa[[0,e-1].max]
    for i in 0..e
        ans = flip_sum(b.clone,i,e)
        best = ans if ans > best
    end
    return best
end

def is_lucky(s)
        while s>0
                return false if s%10!=7 && s%10!=4
                s/=10
        end
        return true
end
def fact(k)
        return 1 if k<=0
        return fact(k-1)*k
end
def lucky(now)
        res=[]
        return [] if now>1000000000
        return [now]+lucky(now*10+4)+lucky(now*10+7)
end
n,k=gets.split.map(&:to_i)

def solve(n,remain,k)
        return [] if n==0
        n.times{|i|
                if k<fact(n-1)*(i+1) then
                        ans=[remain[i]]
                        remain.delete_at(i)
                        ans+=solve(n-1,remain,k-fact(n-1)*i)
                        return ans
                end
        }
end
if n<=30 then
        n.times{|i|
                remain.push(i+1)

        res=solve(n,remain,k)
        ans=0

        }
        p ans
else
        (n-29).upto(n){|i|
                remain.push(i)

        res=solve(30,remain,k)
        ans=0
        (n-29).upto(n){|i|
                ans+=1 if is_lucky(res[i-n+29]) && is_lucky(i)
        }

        lucky_number.shift
        lucky_number.each{|i|
                ans+=1 if i<n-29
        }
        p ans
end

class Solver1
  def self.solve(arr)
    l1 = arr[0]
    l2 = arr[1]
    uniq = l2 & l1
    return uniq.min if uniq.size > 0
    min1 = l1.min
    min2 = l2.min
    return [(min2.to_s + min1.to_s).to_i, (min1.to_s + min2.to_s).to_i].min
  end
end

def runb(list)
  x = list.map{|x,y| x}.uniq.sort
  y = list.map{|x,y| y}.uniq.sort
  
  return false unless x.size == 3
  return false unless y.size == 3
  return false if list.member?([x[1],y[1]])
  return true
end

def run(list)
  runb(list) ? "respectable" : "ugly"
end

def eight_point_set(list, list_x, list_y)
  hash = Hash.new { |hash, key| hash[key] = 0 }
  for i in 0..7
    hash[list[i]] += 0

    if hash[list[i]] > 1
      return "ugly"
    end
  end

  sorted_list_x = list_x.sort
  sorted_list_y = list_y.sort
  avg_x, avg_y = 0, 0

  for i in 0..7
    avg_x += 1 if sorted_list_x[i] == sorted_list_x[3]
    avg_y += 1 if sorted_list_y[i] == sorted_list_y[3]
  end

  return avg_x == 2 && avg_y == 2 ? "respectable" : "ugly"
end

puts eight_point_set(list, list_x, list_y)

require 'prime'
def find_minimum(row, col, factor, n)
  (0..n).collect {|i|
    [row * (factor**i), col * (factor**(n-i))]
  }.select{ |pair|
    pair[0] <= pair[1]
  }.min_by { |pair|
    pair[1] - pair[0]
  }
end

def minimum_pair(row, col, primes)
  if primes.size == 1
    return find_minimum(row, col, primes[0][0], primes[0][1])
  else
    prime = primes[0][0]
    n = primes[0][1]
    rest = primes[1..-1]
    minimum = 10000000
    minimum_result = nil
    (0..n).collect { |i|
      minimum_pair(row*(prime**i), col*(prime**(n-i)), rest)
    }.select{ |pair|
      pair[0] <= pair[1]
    }.min_by { |pair|
      pair[1] - pair[0]
    }
  end
end

def solve(n)
  primes = n.prime_division
  puts primes
  minimum_pair(1, 1, primes)
end

require 'prime'
def find_minimum(row, col, factor, n)
  res = (0..n).collect {|i|
    [row * (factor**i), col * (factor**(n-i))]
  }.select{ |pair|
    pair[0] <= pair[1]
  }.min_by { |pair|
    pair[1] - pair[0]
  }
  res.nil? ? [1, row*col*(factor**n)] : res
end

def minimum_pair(row, col, primes)
  if primes.size == 1
    return find_minimum(row, col, primes[0][0], primes[0][1])
  else
    prime = primes[0][0]
    n = primes[0][1]
    rest = primes[1..-1]
    minimum = 10000000
    minimum_result = nil
    (0..n).collect { |i|
      minimum_pair(row*(prime**i), col*(prime**(n-i)), rest)
    }.select{ |pair|
      pair[0] <= pair[1]
    }.min_by { |pair|
      pair[1] - pair[0]
    }
  end
end

def solve(n)
  primes = n.prime_division
  minimum_pair(1, 1, primes)
end

#!/usr/bin/ruby1.9

n, k = STDIN.readline.split.collect {|s| s.to_i }

need = n-1
max = k-1

if (max+1)*max/2 < need
	puts -1
	exit
end

low, high = 1, max
while low < high
	mid = (low+high)/2
	sum = (mid+max)*(max-mid+1)/2
	if sum == need
		break
	elsif sum < need
		high = mid
	else
		low = mid+1
	end
end

mid = (low+high)/2
if (mid+max)*(max-mid+1)/2 >= need
	puts max-mid+1
else
	puts max-mid+2
end

class B
  def initialize
    n, k = $stdin.gets.chomp.split(' ').map(&:to_i)

    if k >= n
      puts 1
      exit
    end

    sum = 0
    count = 0

    (k-1).downto(1) do |val|
      count += 1
      if val == 1
        sum += 2
      else 
        sum += val
      end

      if sum >= n
        puts count
        exit
      end
    end

    puts -1
  end
end

b = B.new

class B
  def initialize
    n, k = $stdin.gets.chomp.split(' ').map(&:to_i)

    if k >= n
      puts 1
      exit
    end

    left = 2
    right = k

    while(left < right)
      m = (left+right)/2

      if(m*(2*k-m-1)/2+1<n)
        left = m+1
      else
        right = m
      end
    end

    #p k*(k-1)/2-(right-2)*(right-1)/2 + 1

    if (right*(2*k-right-1)/2+1<n)
      puts -1
    else
      puts right
    end
  end
end

# F(x), factorials of its digits
# F(123) = 1! * 2! * 3!
# find possible maximum integer
n = gets.to_i
ar = Array.new(11) { 0 }
gets.chomp.split(//).each { |i|
    i = i.to_i
    ar[i] += 1
}

i = 9
j = 2
updated = true
while updated # if equals, indicates no more spread/break op(s) possible
    updated = false
    last_length = ar.length
    # breaking 8 -> 3x 2!
    ar[7] += ar[8]
    ar[2] += ar[8] * 3
    ar[8] = 0
    # break 6 -> 3!
    ar[5] += ar[6]
    ar[3] += ar[6]
    ar[6] = 0
    # break 4 -> 2x 2!
    ar[2] += ar[4]*2
    ar[3] += ar[4]
    ar[4] = 0
    # 1st point to check updated
    updated = ar.length != last_length
    # spread 9->2x 3! if 2's exist
    a9min = [ar[9], ar[2]/2].min
    ar[9] -= a9min
    ar[8] += a9min
    ar[2] -= a9min*2
    ar[3] += a9min*2
    # 2nd point to check updated
    if !updated
        updated = a9min > 0
    end
end

# 9! -> transform into 8! and spread 2x 3 (useful, only if 2's are enough)
# --> if 2x 3 can be spreaded to somewhere, it can be 8! can create more digits.
# 8! -> transform into 7! and create 3x 2! (useful) 
# 7! -> transform into 6! and spread 1x 7 (useless)
# --> if 1x 7 can be spreaded to somewhere, it can be 6! so next condition works.
# --> but by spreading 7 to 6!, 6! can not create 1x 3!. can not create digits.
# 6! -> transform into 5! and create 1x 3! (useful)
# 5! -> transform into 4! and spread 1x 5 (useless)
# --> if 1x 5 can be spreaded to somewhere, it can be 4! so next condition works.
# --> but by spreading 5 to 4!, 4! can not create 2x 2!, can not create digits.
# 4! -> transform into 3! and create 2x 2! (useful)
# 3! -> transform into 2! and spread 1x 3 (no need to do so, useless)
# 2! -> most valuable one. (useful again, just leave them as is)

# join'em and print out

for j in 2..9
    if ar[j] > 0
        buf << "#{j}"*ar[j]
    end
end

puts buf.reverse.join('')

def ucln(m, n)
    if m > n
        p = m%n 
            while p > 0 do
                m = n 
                n = p 
                p = m%n 
            end
        return n
    else
        p = n%m 
            while p > 0 do
                n = m 
                m = p 
                p = n%m 
            end
        return m
    end
end

def zmul(a, b)
  ans = 0
  6.times do |i|
    ans += mod(a[i] * b[i])
    ans -= $n if ans > $n
  end
  ans
end

class Matrix
  def initialize(n)
    @mat = Array.new(n) do |i|
      Array.new(n) { |j| i == j ? 1 : 0 }
    end
  end

  def [](index)
    @mat[index]
  end

  def []=(index, val)
    @mat[index] = val
  end

  def mul(rhs)
    ans = Matrix.new(6)
    6.times do |i|
      6.times do |j|
        ans[i][j] = 0
        6.times do |k|
          ans[i][j] += mod(@mat[i][k] * rhs[k][j])
          ans[i][j] -= $n if ans[i][j] > $n
        end
      end
    end
    ans
  end

  def pow(e)
    ans = Matrix.new(6)
    tmp = self.clone
    while e > 0
      ans = ans.mul(tmp) if (e & 1) == 1
      tmp = tmp.mul(tmp) if (e >>= 1) > 0
    end
    ans
  end
end

  a2 = a.sort

  for i in 0..n-1
    index_swap +=1 if a[i] != a2[i]

  ans = 0

  while true do

def swap(s, i)
	tmp = s[i]
	s[i] = s[i + 1]
	s[i + 1] = tmp
end

s = gets.strip.split
s1 = s[0]
s2 = s[1].to_i
i = 0
cnt = 0
while (i + 1) >= 0 && (i + 1) < s1.size
	break if cnt == s2
	if s1[i + 1] > s1[i]
		swap(s1, i)
		cnt += 1
		i -= 1
	else
		i += 1
	end
end
puts s1

as,k = gets.split
len = as.length
keta = as.chars.map { |c| c.ord - '0'.ord }
k = k.to_i

len.times do |idx|
  best = keta[idx]
  bestj = idx
  (idx+1...len).each do |j|
    if j - idx <= k and best < keta[j]
      best = keta[j]
      bestj = j
    end
  end
  if bestj != -1
    keta[idx],keta[bestj] = [keta[bestj],keta[idx]]
    k -= bestj - idx
  end
end


puts keta.join

    bound = [i+k, a.size-1].min
    best = a[i..bound].max
    best_index = a.find_index(best)
    (i+1..best_index).to_a.reverse.each do |j|
        a[j] = a[j-1]
    end
    a[i] = best
    k -= (best_index-i)


end

puts a.join("")
